title: Scrambled Eggs with Salmon Roe Recipe
full_text:
Scrambled Eggs with Salmon Roe Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
5 mins
Cook
5 mins
Active
10 mins
Total
10 mins
Serves
1 serving
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
2
eggs
1
tablespoon
heavy cream or
crème fraîche
1
tablespoon
butter
3
tablespoons
salmon roe
Freshly chopped herbs
of your choice
Freshly ground black pepper
Directions
Whisk eggs with cream and set aside.
In a skillet over medium heat, melt butter. When butter has melted, add eggs, and whisk to form eggs into a curd-like texture. When eggs are halfway set, add roe and stir around briefly, then turn off heat and let the heat of the pan continue to cook the eggs for a few more seconds.
Garnish with herbs and black pepper. Serve immediately.
Special Equipment
Sauté pan
Notes
Salmon roe is available at most Japanese or Korean stores where sushi-grade fish is sold, and can also be found packed in glass jars at artisanal food stores.
Breakfast & Brunch
Stovetop Eggs
Scrambled Eggs
Salmon
